byline.original: By BARNARD L. COLLIER Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, April 13--President Johnson's meetings with other American chiefs of state reached a climax this evening when the Latin leaders overwhelmed Ecuador's demand for more help from Washington and vowed to open a new era of...
docs.lead_paragraph: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, April 13--President Johnson's meetings with other American chiefs of state reached a climax this evening when the Latin leaders overwhelmed Ecuador's demand for more help from Washington and vowed to open a new era of economic development.
docs.abstract: Presidents in closed session ratify plan of action; laud Johnson for not merely offering aid, ask more than US lip service to econ integration and self-help plans; oppose and overwhelm Arosemena demands for more US aid and his charge that US neglect will cause revolution and civil war in hemisphere; note Ecuadorian unwillingness to raise local taxation needed to meet inter-Amer agencies' loan conditions; Johnson offers more aid provided govts hon common mkt and other econ cooperation pledges, s; later, in response to Arosemena's and other demands, urges leaders re-examine their service to their people; pledges to try to free some project loans from requirement that they be used for US goods; notes his Adm has increased aid 35% over Kennedy Adm; Johnson's favorable impact on Latin Amers, especially in private talks, noted

headline.main: Latin Leaders Overwhelm Ecuador's Aid Demands; They Override Arosemena After He Warns Neglect by Washington May Spur Revolution in Hemisphere AMERICAN CHIEFS AGREE ON PROJECT

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSESSIONS

byline.original: By MAX FRANKEL Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, April 13--Following is the official text of the "plan of action" of the American chiefs of state, scheduled for signing tomorrow. The term "Latin America" in the text includes all members of the Organization of American...
docs.lead_paragraph: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, April 13--Following is the official text of the "plan of action" of the American chiefs of state, scheduled for signing tomorrow. The term "Latin America" in the text includes all members of the Organization of American States except the United States. "Presidents" includes the Prime Minister of Trinidad and Tobago. "Continent" comprises islands as well.

headline.main: Text of Plan of Action Due to Be Signed by American Chiefs of State Today; Television, Education and Science Projects Discussed in Punta del Este Plan
